text: The Smiling Rabbit
Once upon a time, an old man and woman lived in a little house.
They had a rabbit and a jaguar.
"I'm hungry," said the man.
"Let's cook the rabbit!" said the woman.
They made a fire and heated up water.
"Oh, no!" said Jaguar.
"Rabbit! They're going to eat you!" cried Jaguar.
But Rabbit wasn't worried.
"No, no. They're just making hot chocolate," he said.
"No! They're going to cook you!" cried Jaguar.
"No, no," said Rabbit.
"I'll show you."
"Huh?" said Jaguar.
"Get into my cage.
"Then they'll give you the hot chocolate," said Rabbit.
"Okay," said Jaguar, and he got into the cage.
Rabbit ran away.
Jaguar waited and waited.
"Where's that Rabbit? Grr!"
Jaguar was angry.
He broke the cage and went to look for Rabbit.
He found him in a cave.
"Hi, Jaguar!" said Rabbit.
"Grr! I'm going to eat you!" said Jaguar.
"But why?" asked rabbit.
"Because you tricked me!" yelled Jaguar.
"Wait!" cried Rabbit.
"The cave is falling down on us!"
"Oh, no! What should we do?
What should we do?" cried Jaguar .
Rabbit said, "Hold up the wall and I'll go find help."
"Okay," said Jaguar, and he held up the wall.
Rabbit ran away.
Jaguar waited and waited.
He stopped holding up the wall, and it didn't fall down.
"Where's that Rabbit? Grr!"
Jaguar was angry.
jaguar left the cave and went to look for Rabbit.
He found him in a tree.
Rabbit was playing on a branch
"Hi, Jaguar!" he sid.
"Grr! I'm going to eat you!" said Jaguar.
"But why?" asked rabbit.
"Because you tricked me!" yelled Jaguar.
He grabbed the branch and pulled it lower and lower.
"Wait!" cried Rabbit.
"The tree is falling down on us!"
"Oh, no!" What should we do?
What should we do?" cried Jaguar .
Rabbit said, "Let's go of the branch.
Then the tree won't break."
"Okay," said Jaguar, and he let go.
Rabbit flew up in the sky.
He laughed and laughed at foolish Jaguar.
"See ya, silly Jaguar!
I'm going to the moon!" he called.
Jaguar showed his teeth.
"Grr! Rabbit, you tricked me again!" yelled Jaguar.
But Rabbit only flew higher and higher.
Rabbit was spinning and flying through the air,
He laughed and laughed.
Rabbit flew all the way to the moon.
And at night when the moon is full, you can still see the smiling rabbit.
